fact_check_explanation_title: Flu isn’t the underlying cause of death for more people than Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: Figures from the Office for National Statistics are being widely misunderstood. Flu isn’t the underlying cause of death for more people than Covid-19 at the moment, but pneumonia probably is.

fact_check_explanation_title: Study doesn’t show that children are ‘silent super-spreaders’ of coronavirus
fact_check_explanation_summary: A study into the quantity of Covid-19 carried by some children does not prove they are ‘silent super-spreaders’.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims that Warburtons now gets its wheat from the USA are wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: The company changed suppliers but it will continue to get some of its wheat from the UK and some from Canada.

fact_check_explanation_title: Lowering the state pension age for women won't create four million jobs for young people
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Facebook incorrectly claims that allowing women born in the 1950s to retire at age 60 would create four million jobs for young people.

fact_check_explanation_title: You’re allowed to leave England if you’re self-isolating for 14 days following a trip abroad
fact_check_explanation_summary: Provided you travel directly to your point of departure you can travel from England during the 14 day quarantine period.

fact_check_explanation_title: Infrared thermometers do not affect the pineal gland
fact_check_explanation_summary: These thermometers do not emit infrared radiation, they measure it.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral Facebook post on cost of “binned” test and trace app is wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: The app hasn’t been binned, although the government did change direction with their original app to instead use the Google/Apple system.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral Facebook post compares the national living wage with the state pension
fact_check_explanation_summary: The post uses an average figure for the poorest pensioners and compares that to the minimum wage for people over 25.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims that a 2011 lightning composite picture were taken in the Lake District are false
fact_check_explanation_summary: A photo went viral after a Facebook user claimed it was taken in Calbeck, but they later said that was a joke.

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s not true that migrants get a free TV licence
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely shared post on Facebook incorrectly claims migrants who arrive in Britain receive a free TV licence, while pensioners have to pay for one.

fact_check_explanation_title: You cannot catch Legionnaires’ disease from a mask
fact_check_explanation_summary: Legionnaires’ disease is a bacterial infection caught through water.

fact_check_explanation_title: Charles Bronson has not attacked Ian Huntley in prison
fact_check_explanation_summary: The men are in two different prisons.
